intro: Okoubaka aubrevillei var. glabrescentifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved okoubaka, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the rainy season. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
